PreparerFirmName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: TYLER SIMMS & ST SAUVEUR CPA PC

IRS990.MissionDesc: TO OFFER A CLOSE-KNIT COMMUNITY THAT PREPARES MIDDLE SCHOOL BOYS IN MIND, BODY, AND SPIRIT FOR RESPONSIBLE AND MEANINGFUL LIVES IN A GLOBAL SOCIETY.
IRS990.Desc: AN INDEPENDENT MIDDLE SCHOOL FOR BOYS IN GRADES SIX THROUGH NINE OFFERING A STRONG ACADEMIC AND ATHLETIC PROGRAM. THERE WERE 212 STUDENTS IN THIS PROGRAM DURING THE FISCAL YEAR.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: A SUMMER SESSION FOR BOYS AND GIRLS IN GRADES THREE THROUGH NINE OFFERING RECREATIONAL AND EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCES. IN ADDITION, THE CARDIGAN MOUNTAIN SCHOOL OFFERS THE CORE PROGRAM THAT SEEKS TO INSTILL IN BOYS A LIFELONG PASSION FOR THE OUTDOORS WHILE DEVELOPING THE NECESSARY SKILLS TO FULLY PURSUE THIS PASSION FOR A LIFETIME.

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.TitleTxt: ASSISTANT HEAD OF SCHOOL AND DEAN OF FACULTY

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PURPOSE OF THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS IS TO MAINTAIN A PREDICTABLE STREAM OF FUNDING FOR THE PROGRAMS SUPPORTED BY THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS.

ACCOUNTING STANDARDS CODIFICATION SUBTOPIC 740-10, ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES, ADDRESSES THE ACCOUNTING UNCERTAINTY OF INCOME TAXES RECOGNIZED IN AN ENTERPRISE'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND PRESCRIBES A THRESHOLD OF "MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT" FOR RECOGNITION AND DERECOGNITION OF TAX POSITIONS TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN IN A TAX RETURN. SUBTOPIC 740-10 ALSO PROVIDES GUIDANCE ON MEASUREMENT CLASSIFICATION, INTEREST AND PENALTIES AND DISCLOSURE. THE SCHOOL HAS DETERMINED THAT THE PROVISIONS OF SUBTOPIC 740-10 DO NOT HAVE A MATERIAL EFFECT ON THE SCHOOL'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE SCHOOL BELIEVES IT IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO EXAMINATIONS FOR YEARS PRIOR TO 2012.
FINANCIAL AID -2,472,718. PROVISION FOR PLEDGES -232,204. CAPITAL CAMPAIGN EXPENSES -367,552.
FINANICAL AID 2,472,718. PROVISION FOR PLEDGES 232,204. CAPITAL CAMPAIGN EXPENSES 367,552.
CARDIGAN MOUNTAIN SCHOOL'S NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY IS PUBLISHED ANNUALLY IN THE BOSTON GLOBE.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.NonCashAssistanceDesc: FINANCIAL AID IS GIVEN TO STUDENTS BASED ON NEED AND ON SCHOLASTIC ABILITY. NAMES AND ADDRESSES OF RECIPIENTS ARE AVAILABLE IN THE SCHOOL'S BUSINESS OFFICE.

RltdOrgOfficerTrstKeyEmplGrp.TitleTxt: ASSISTANT HEAD OF SCHOOL AND DEAN OF

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: HOUSING IS PROVIDED AS A CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT.
ALL STOCK GIFTS ARE SENT TO THEIR MERRILL LYNCH ACCOUNT AND THEN SOLD IMMEDIATELY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PRIOR TO THE FILING OF THE FORM 990. IT IS REVIEWED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES DOES NOT REVIEW SCHEDULE B.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION REGULARLY AND CONSISTENTLY MONITORS AND ENFORCES COMPLIANCE WITH ITS CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. THE ORGANIZATION REQUIRES BOARD MEMBERS TO DISCLOSE ANNUALLY ANY INTERESTS THAT COULD GIVE RISE TO A CONFLICT. IF A MEMBER HAS A CONFLICT OF INTEREST WITH A PARTICULAR MATTER, THAT MEMBER WILL LEAVE THE MEETING WHEN A VOTE IS TAKEN.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THERE IS A SUB-COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD, THE DISQUALIFIED EMPLOYEES SUB-COMMITTEE, THAT MEETS AND USES NATIONAL AND REGIONAL STATISTICS ON OTHER INSTITUTION'S COMPENSATION FOR KEY EMPLOYEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, FORM 990, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
THE AUDIT COMMITTEE ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR OVERSEEING THE ANNUAL AUDIT, INCLUDING THE SELECTION OF THE INDEPENDENT AUDITOR. THIS PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED SINCE THE PRIOR YEAR.
